Reviews.Title: “in the center of istanbul”
Reviews.Author: mrtdncr
Reviews.Content: Location is good (but if you want to be closer to Sultanahmet then you should not choose it), rooms are clean and tidy,staffs are helpful,breakfast is ordinary,not perfect

Reviews.Title: “Below expectations as a 4*”
Reviews.Author: Lina-Omar
Reviews.Content: In Istanbul 4* hotels can be measured as 3* or less comparing to Europe â€¦ so itâ€™s not the only hotel below 4* prospects . Rooms where ok , but the bathroom and the shower were unclean as needed , the light is white neon everywhere in the room , even the table lamps which was so uncomfortable ,apparently not all rooms the same ! no locker in rooms , but you can leave your passports and valuable stuff at the receptionâ€™s lockers which you will have a key for it during your stay. We stayed for 4 nights , and weâ€™ll choose a 5* next time, the bed is not that comfy , there is a kettle , 2 Nescafe & tea bags which were consumed at the first day and they never supply another ones during our 5 days stay . Breakfast is fine but limited itâ€™s recommended to have it somewhere out if your reservation can be excluded of breakfast .btw Elevators are very slow! Spa is average has a steam , sauna , swimming pool and Turkish bath better to reserve in advance. On the other hand the location is good ,10 â€“ 15 min walk to main Istiklal street and metro station, located in a nice hotels area and taxiâ€™s not really expensive .Service is efficient and Hotels staff are pleasant , welcoming and flexible .

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmanza
Reviews.Content: The position of the hotel is excellent to visit the city. It is very close to Taksim square where a lot of public transportation is available. The rooms are large, comfortable and clean; the wi-fi is free of charge in the room. The breakfast is good with a large choice of food. The staff is very kind.

Reviews.Title: “Green Park - what a lark!”
Reviews.Author: MrFredBahrain
Reviews.Content: A travel agent in Istanbul sold us a room at "The 5 star Green Park Taksim", as we were coming back through Istanbul again, but he sold us a pup! The hotel was very tired looking, gloomy (NO Management, low lighting can be romantic for effect, but that is not much fun when you want to READ instead and you cannot because the room looks as though it is in a brown out! Bathroom is tiny and has any Manager tried sitting ('h' left out!) on the loo and trying to access the loo paper! Mission Impossible! Open the shower 'curtain' - a plastic dual door job that came off the hinges - and turn on the shower and the floor floods! We had room 904, right next to the lift - which clunked all night - and the street noise and barking dogs continued most of the night as well. Breakfast spread was the worst that we experienced in our Turkey travels and the 'scrambled eggs' tasted (well the one fork full we did taste - was like chicken grit. Area around the hotel noisy and unappealing. Staff were helpful, but then they were everywhere in Turkey. Why oh why didn't we take the extra night at the Four Star Maywood - far less cost, and oh so much nicer!

Reviews.Title: “its 2 star not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: nastaranny
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 1 night for business but I never stay there again.despite of the renovation,the hotel is very old with old furniture and it looks like a 2 star hotel.the breakfast place is very crowded,noisy and they cant handle it properly.the staffs ware not friendly.the shower was very bad and the water stop in the tub

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: M R
Reviews.Content: i advise everyone who plan to stay in this hotel to put their money in their big bag with lock .. do not leave your money in safety box or in room ... we had a problem of stolen around 5 thousand dollar from the room !! ... how come stolen and the room locked ?? this is someone from the stuff we are sure .. after creating a noise and calling police money returned to another bag , another booked room ,, we had 3 rooms .. rooms are extermly dark and there is no saftey box in some rooms !! ... tratment by stuff is very bad and some nights you wont be able to sleep from the parties and noise created out side from those who celebrate !! ... Bathrooms are also not that much good plus AC problems, ,, HOT !! if you want to save your health and enjoy your stay .. : dont think about this hotel ever ! NEVER !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel I think I will come back”
Reviews.Author: Ezzat611
Reviews.Content: The staff at reception is very friendly and helpfull, the room is very good and clean. The location of the hotel is very good No free WiFi but expesive daily fee. the quality and variety of food in breakfast isn't good

Reviews.Title: “nice and nasty”
Reviews.Author: punkt1manden
Reviews.Content: I have stayed on this hotel 2 times. In 2010 and 2011 on 2 days stays. It looks fantastic in the lobby and the staff is quick and helpful when you arrive and everything looks fine. But when you take the really slow elevator up too your room, you find out that all floors have carpets with the smell of stuffy. I still remember the first stay in 2010 where I kept thinking "what if there is a fire in the hotel and i am located on 7 th floor with carpets everywhere? " The room is standard size and the bed is comfortable :-) lcd tv, mini bar. Breakfast is traditional turkish and continental breakfast, which was a joke and very un-tasty :-( The spa was a ripoff. The prices is the highest, I ever payed for at turkish bath. I payed for 20 min massage, but i only got 5 min. Complaining was total waist off mine and their time. I payed for 5 people x 20 min and we was all finished after 45 min. I cant recommend the spa !

Reviews.Title: “Really good location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: PARO_10
Reviews.Content: This place was great.....it is centrally located and if your old and dont want to deal with a busy area then dont stay here lol. We came to have fun and party and had a gret time. The hotel is clean and friendly. It is near bus...train and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “good money value”
Reviews.Author: Etshos
Reviews.Content: the location is very good rooms are simple and clean the staff is friendly but they cant speech english will as most of turkish people but at all it was pleasant 5 days stay and i would repeat it again

Reviews.Title: “captainmoro123@yahoo.com”
Reviews.Author: maxx05
Reviews.Content: Horrable customer service,Horable wedding organizer(Plilis) Misleading,and never will do what you want and will surprise you on your day with bad surprises she already knew it before.The food you pay for is not what you will get,No WIFI in the rooms(Doesn't work),No AC in the room for 5 Hrs?If you reserve and pay for the pool don't expect to get it they will tell you it was windy althought it was hot and no breez,Just a compleet RIP OFF place,very rude staff , over all,NEVER AGAIN and don't do the same mistake.

Reviews.Title: “the worst staff i ever seen...”
Reviews.Author: JohnPapa
Reviews.Content: Firts of all sorry for my english... I am Greek. We stay at the hotel for 3 nights.... the rooms were not so clean... the bathroom was very bad... i have problem with my aircondition... for three nights i couldnt sleep. the staf every day tell me that they will fix it... or they will change me room... nothing... very unfriendly staff... the worst i ever seen.. One lady of my group he had a problem with her bathroom.. nobody help her... it was amazing how was their behaviour.... Avoid this hotel... i am traveling in istanbul every 2-3 weeks... This hotel its the worst i stay... the only good its the location.. very close to Taxim square... but i will never get there... one thing again... they charge the Wi fi internet, 10 euro per day... amazing...

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Guaco-Guaco
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent three days staying at this hotel. It is located in an area so loud that if you want to sleep you can not open the window and still closed you hear the scandal of traffic and people partying. Our bathroom was losing water and after telling them no one came to fix it. In addition, we request at our departure we required their shuttle service to the Airport and they charged us 25 euros per person, when no taxis or private transport services they charge per person, but for service (at least, if you are only 2 people). We left with a bad impression of this hotel and I do not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “AVERAGE HOTEL BUT PLEASANT STAY”
Reviews.Author: abat
Reviews.Content: First of all I must say that I rate Green Park as a very good hotel for Istanbul standards based in location, price and cleanliness. Our room was on the 3rd floor in front of a busy street that after 23.00 gets a little more quiet. Room was big with new carpet on the floor and average bathroom size with some toiletries provided by the hotel. Breakfast was good with great variety of bread, cheese and some local specialties (scramble eggs with spinach! Not my favour but original) and fruits. Hot chocolate on demand and you had to pay. That's not good guys. Restaurant on the 10th floor was average in prices and food quality but has a great view in a part of the city. Gym was good and you could use for free the sauna, the tiny swimming pool and the turkish bath. Parking was free. I've parked the car outside of the Hotel, the bell boy took it (gave him a tip) and after 4 days when we left he brought it back again in one piece (gave him again something). The Hotel is located less than 5 minutes from Taksim square and the main pedestrian street, Istiklar where tens of thousands people walk every single minute. I didn't feel unsafe in the area which is surveilanced 24 hours by private security guards. Rates in the Hotel as in all Hotels varied depending the season and the celebrations. For instance we went on Easter period for both Catholics and Orthodox so prices were higher. Negative remark. Though we didn't use the air condition, we were told from other Hotel customers that it didn't work properly, so be sure before you go. Staff in the Hotel was helpful and polite and most of them had a basic knowledge of English language. You can't find this option easily in Istanbul. P.S. Wifi on demand, I think 10 Euro for whole day but I didn't use it because I wanted to detoxicate!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID, a disgrace to all hotels!”
Reviews.Author: allalouff
Reviews.Content: AVOID AVOID AVOID If you are considering to stay at this hotel, DON'T!!! We checked in at 14:00, we checked out at 17:00 on the same day! We booked the hotel through a travel agency from our country and when we arrived and entered the room we were a bit disappointed because the room had much older furniture than the ones shown at the foto gallery of the hotel web page. Moreover the bathroom was also very old and had several mold stains between the tiles. We decided to overlook all of the above and stay becase the room was big, situated on the corner side of the 7th floor and had an amazing view. So we started unpacking. Normally we never use the drawers of the bedside cabinets. This time, just for fun, I decided to open it !!!! I found myself looking at a USED CONDOM lying down in the middle of the drawer!!!!!! We immediately packed our luggage, the room was cleaned by the cleaning lady of the floor and the hotel suggested to move us to a suite. We never accepted (we were so upset that we didn't even want to have our shoes touching the floor of the that hotel), so we contacted our travel agency and we were moved to another average hotel of the Taksin district because it was the Easter period and we could not find anything better... AVOID AVOID AVOID

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-star hotel, by ANY standards”
Reviews.Author: vgchao
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Green Park in Taxim square while on a group work trip. As the other reviews note, it is centrally located. However, to get to it, taxi drivers must go around the square to enter the one way street. The rooms are very shabby, AC doesn't work, bathrooms are old and mine only had a stand-up shower with traces of mold. Sheets are rough. Loud location, the traffic keeps up until about midnight, then the disco music from the 10th floor starts and goes on until about 4. The only peaceful time is between 4-5AM, then the calls to prayer start (if you have your windows open you hear these) and early morning delivery trucks start running down the street. If you are accustomed to staying in REAL 4 and 5 star hotels, do not be fooled. If you only want a relatively clean and centrally located place to crash for a few hours and the price you get is decent - then try this hotel. Not all rooms have safes (so beware), rooms on lower floors are very loud and have no view. I stayed on the 10th floor which has a great view of Istanbul as well as free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: behrang
Reviews.Content: well, first of all, it is near Taksim square, ;) well, staff are really friendly ( which is a rare thing in turkey!) and though the hotel is not very big ( not like titanic hotel which is one street away from this one) but it is a neat place. well, its food quality is good, but menue is not very selective.well, for me who loves breakfasts, it was limited options to choose. another downer, is safebox. there is no safebox in room, there are ofcourse safeboxes in reception, but, I am one of those who wants to have a safebox in their room. ah, and last thing, if you want to use the pool, you will need a cap...better have it,rather than buy it from hotel!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T”
Reviews.Author: Coastersretreat
Reviews.Content: A four star posing as a rundown three star. AC doesn't work. BUT joy, you can open the window but then the tourist coaches below belch fumes into the room and the traffic keeps you awake all night. Water in shower is a game of chance- could be cold or could scald. Inside it should be called Brown Park- dull brown corridors and room. Hope for good neighbours or you"ll be awake all night as the walls are paper thin. Forget the elevators- walk!

Reviews.Title: “The customer service from the management and staff was exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: IstanbulSport
Reviews.Content: In May, 2009 I traveled to Istanbul from the U.S. to participate in an international sports festival at a university. The group of U.S. athletes and coaches with whom I was affiliated arrived five days or so after I did. During the time that I was on my own at the hotel, as well as the time while our groups stayed at the hotel, the managers and staff were INCREDIBLY helpful and accomodating. My hotel room and the lobby and restaurant were very clean and well-maintained. The only meal that we ate at the Green Park was breakfast, and the variety and quality of the food, compared to some other hotels that I have stayed in during previous trips to Istanbul, was outstanding. The location is very convenient to shopping, restaurants and transportation. I would definitely choose to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Resat_D
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul for only one night on business. I enjoyed the Taksim location, with lots of restaurants and shopping. The Green Park, while very close to the heart of Taksim, is located on a relatively quiet side street. The room was very clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful in providing current information on the city, the wireless internet worked fine-it's free if you use your laptop in the lobby--, and the buffet breakfast was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,best location you can get od Taksim”
Reviews.Author: lisa71Skp
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul last year for a business.My travel agent select this hotel as one of the most convinient for my trip.And I like it...Rooms comfortable,beds big,clean bathroom.Breakfast nice with lot of nice thing to choose.From the hotel you can easy get were ever you want.All in one-very nice acomodation.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here if you have a baby”
Reviews.Author: fjaafar
Reviews.Content: we booked the hotel through TOPKON, who also organised our conference at the Lutfi kirdar conference center not far from taksim square. according to TOPKON, it is a 4 star hotel. since we were coming with our 9 months old baby, we decided to choose this hotel since it provides a babycot free of charge. we arrived at our room and discovered that it was dusty (we could see white dust on furnitures). the fridge in the room has water pooling in it. 3 lamps in the room were not working, tiles on the bathroom floor were broken, the edges all around the bathtub were black with mold. no towels ...all in all it was a disastrous room. as if they were not expecting anybody to stay in that room at all. they told us the hotel was full. fine. we asked for the babycot. the baby cot which they had was metal, with no slates, only some curvy decorations at the side which was big enough for a baby's head to go through. furthermore, it was a swinging babycot! we argued long and hard with the management and at that point our baby was going to sleep. they finally offered us another room with two double beds so we figured we just had to join the two beds and let our baby sleep in between us. the bathroom was in the same condition as the first room so we figured it must be the general condition for bathrooms at this hotel. there is a construction work right next to the hotel so we advise other people not to stay at this hotel for a few months because the contractors also only work in the middle of the night!! i think if you travel with a baby, just bring your own baby cot. they also only one baby highchair at the hotel restaurant. so during breakfast we had to compete with other guests with babies.

Reviews.Title: “Green Park is OK, but better hotels are in the same area”
Reviews.Author: BBinMD
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Green Park for a week in August 08. The hotel is OK, but definitely not 4 star. I would compare the rooms to a Motel 6 or similar chains. We had friends staying in the same area, and their hotels were much nicer (and cheaper, too). Check out the Hotel Gonen (great roof top pool and bar), or the Mid Town Hotel. Both are about a block from the Green Park.

HotelInfo.Name: The Green Park Taksim
HotelInfo.Address: Abdulhak Hamit Cad. No:50 | Taksim, Istanbul 80090, Turkey
